clinical_study.brief_title: Study on Short Chain Fatty Acids Concentration in Breast Milk and Its Correlation With the Maternal Diet
clinical_study.official_title: Short Chain Fatty Acids in Breast Milk

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether the acetate, butyrate and propionate concentration in breast milk and to evaluate the possible correlation of these concentrations with maternal diet.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 10 days after delivery and every 30 days until the fifth month after delivery

secondary_outcome.measure: Relationship between short chain fatty acids in breast milk and maternal diet (amount of fibers in maternal diet and based on this it will evaluate the variations in short chain fatty acids concentration)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 days after delivery and every 30 days until the fifth month after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Relationship between short chain fatty acids in breast milk and maternal diet will be measured by assessing the amount of fibers in maternal diet and based on this it will evaluate the variations in short chain fatty acids concentration. These assessments will be carried out by using a food diary carefully compiled by mothers before each sampling of breast milk

clinical_study.condition: Short Chain Fatty Acids Concentration in Breast Milk

intervention.intervention_name: sampling of breast milk, obtaining information about the maternal diet
intervention.description: take samples of 3 ml breast milk and 3-days diet diaries

study_pop.textblock: parturients women at term hospitalized in the Department of Obstetrics, Gynecology and Pathophysiology of Human Reproduction, "Federico II" University of Naples.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- parturients women at term hospitalized in the Department of Obstetrics, Gynecology and Pathophysiology of Human Reproduction, "Federico II" University of Naples.
Exclusion Criteria:
- infections,
- diabetes and other chronic diseases at the level of each organ or system,
- diseases of pregnancy.
- antibiotics, prebiotics, probiotics and synbiotics in the 30 days prior to the first observation.
